page.title: 14Home Life
page.content: The weekly shopping expedition to the supermarkets in the neighbouring town of High Wycombe has largely replaced the buying of food in the local shops.Only a small fraction use the neighbourhood shops on a regular basis,though most use them at times. Convenience foods and take-aways are in general use - though a recent campaign to encourage children towards healthy eating habits has been carried out at Downley Middle School. Although less than 10% work allot- ments,vegetables and fruit feature in many gardens.As well as the popular beans,tomatoes,potatoes,onions and carrots,gardeners are experimenting with courgettes,asparagus and spinach. Similarly,while apples, rhubarb and soft fruits remain the predominant fruits grown,grapes,peaches,melons, and figs feature in some gardens.
